artefact: Tell HMRC about a change of name or address

artefact.overview: Send a secure email to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) to report your change of name or address
artefact.more_information:
##Evidence
You'll need to provide various types of evidence, depending on what you want to tell HMRC and on your circumstances. You'll normally need at least one of the following:

* UTR (unique taxpayer reference) number, which you can find on letters you have from HMRC
* your current or last employer's name
* private pension details (the provider's name and the pension number)
* details of any previous names (and of your partner's)

%HMRC will update your details in various services, including PAYE (Pay As You Earn), National Insurance and Child Benefit - they will also tell the Government Gateway and the Pension Service.%

*[HMRC]: Her Majesty's Revenue & Customs
*[UTR]: unique taxpayer reference
*[PAYE]: Pay As You Earn
artefact.introduction:
You can send a secure email to HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) to report your change of name or address. Find out what email service you need to use - this will depend on your circumstances.

*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs

details.description: Includes filing, deadlines, pay and tax records
Includes VAT, debt and inheritance tax

Change your name and address on your vehicle registration certificate (V5C)
